Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

The UniversalExtractor should not be very CPU consuming because it only run=
s
on documents that other extractors pass on. This means that it handles a
=
relatively small number of documents. Furthermore it (by default) does not
=
consider more then the first 10k of a file and its analysis algorithm is
fa=
irly robust.
 
Using heritrix-1.5.0-200506132127 I started a crawl yesterda=
y (over a large
scope) and found it to run quite a lot faster then similar =
crawls done in
May (bandwidth utilization was running at 4000K/sec initiall=
y and after 18
hours has averaged 3000K/sec). Since then some commits have =
been made, I
suppose it is possible that a problem was introduced. You may =
want to try
using a slightly older build and see if that solves your proble=
ms.
 
- Kris
 
 
-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogrou=
ps.com
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Bjarne Anderse=
n
Sent: 15. j=FAn=ED 2005 06:50
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject=
: Re: [archive-crawler] Slowdown



It might be the universal extractor - a=
s I recall it's quite CPU 
consuming? - correct me Stack or Gordon if I'm w=
rong

My crawls are running at around the same speed with yesterdays build.=


best
Bjarne Andersen

Matt Ittigson wrote:
> Some change in the code betw=
een earlier today and May 31st has caused
> a massive slowdown in the speed=
 which I'm downloading data.  On the
> same machine, configured in the same=
 way, a version of Heritrix I
> built from CVS, from earlier today, could n=
ot muster more than 30K/s
> on the same seed file that the May 31st version=
 is currently doing
> 728K/s.
> 
> Perhaps the difference is in configurati=
on?  Maybe I'm enabling a
> newer configuration variable which is slowing t=
hings down?  The
> difference between the order.xml files are only addition=
s in the newer
> version:
> 
> reread-seeds-on-config: true
> use-bdb-for-c=
ookies: true
> the universal extractor (with default configuration)
> LinkS=
coper instead of Postselector (with default configuration)
> 
> Would any o=
f the log files be of use to track down the problem?
> 
> Thanks.
> 
> -mat=
t
